texts.label: text
texts.orig: Because of the nature and requirements of the work, the Local Lodge and the Employers have agreed to the following Letter of Understanding for the performance of the following work:
texts.text: Because of the nature and requirements of the work, the Local Lodge and the Employers have agreed to the following Letter of Understanding for the performance of the following work:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The erection, dismantling, rework, repair, or demolition of: storage tanks, reservoirs, standpipes, water towers, spheres and other plate work erection which has traditionally been considered by the Local Lodge and Employer as falling under the scope and intent of 'Tank Work'.
texts.text: The erection, dismantling, rework, repair, or demolition of: storage tanks, reservoirs, standpipes, water towers, spheres and other plate work erection which has traditionally been considered by the Local Lodge and Employer as falling under the scope and intent of 'Tank Work'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Employers have agreed with the Local Lodge as to the importance and requirements of employing qualified members of the Local Lodge whenever they are available. The Local Lodge has recognized the nature of the experience and qualifications required for this work. The Employer will consult with the Business Manager of the Local Lodge having jurisdiction over the project ten (10) days in advance of the start of the project regarding manpower requirements.
texts.text: The Employers have agreed with the Local Lodge as to the importance and requirements of employing qualified members of the Local Lodge whenever they are available. The Local Lodge has recognized the nature of the experience and qualifications required for this work. The Employer will consult with the Business Manager of the Local Lodge having jurisdiction over the project ten (10) days in advance of the start of the project regarding manpower requirements.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Employer with mutual agreement with the Local Lodge Business Manager will be permitted to name hire from the Out of Work List of the Local Lodge, two (2) employees who are qualified to and will perform the operation of any automatic welder. The Employer may also select six (6) Journeypersons from any Out of Work List of the Local Lodge for every New Project for up to the first four (4) tanks. For every additional group of four (4) tanks or part thereof the Employer will be extended the same name hire provisions as above.
texts.text: The Employer with mutual agreement with the Local Lodge Business Manager will be permitted to name hire from the Out of Work List of the Local Lodge, two (2) employees who are qualified to and will perform the operation of any automatic welder. The Employer may also select six (6) Journeypersons from any Out of Work List of the Local Lodge for every New Project for up to the first four (4) tanks. For every additional group of four (4) tanks or part thereof the Employer will be extended the same name hire provisions as above.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The next five (5) employees will be dispatched from the Local Out of Work List without regard for name hire privilege.
texts.text: The next five (5) employees will be dispatched from the Local Out of Work List without regard for name hire privilege.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: All additional employees shall be dispatched on the basis of twenty-five percent (25%) name hire.
texts.text: All additional employees shall be dispatched on the basis of twenty-five percent (25%) name hire.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Inclement Weather: When an employee reports to work and cannot work because of inclement weather they shall be paid two (2) hours reporting time and the employee must remain on the job for the two (2) hour period, unless otherwise instructed by the Employer's supervisor. When an employee has commenced work and is instructed to stop due to inclement weather, they shall be paid for the actual time worked. In no case shall an employee receive less than two (2) hours pay.
texts.text: Inclement Weather: When an employee reports to work and cannot work because of inclement weather they shall be paid two (2) hours reporting time and the employee must remain on the job for the two (2) hour period, unless otherwise instructed by the Employer's supervisor. When an employee has commenced work and is instructed to stop due to inclement weather, they shall be paid for the actual time worked. In no case shall an employee receive less than two (2) hours pay.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Work Not Available. When an employee reports to work and is not given the opportunity to work because none is available or was not advised before the completion of the previous day's work, they shall be paid two (2) hours reporting time and allowed to leave the job immediately.
texts.text: Work Not Available. When an employee reports to work and is not given the opportunity to work because none is available or was not advised before the completion of the previous day's work, they shall be paid two (2) hours reporting time and allowed to leave the job immediately.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: When an employee has started to work on their regular shift and is instructed to stop, they shall be paid for the actual time worked. In no case shall the employee receive less than two (2) hours pay.
texts.text: When an employee has started to work on their regular shift and is instructed to stop, they shall be paid for the actual time worked. In no case shall the employee receive less than two (2) hours pay.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If  an  employee  stops  work  for  reasons  of  their  own,  and  without  the  approval  of  the Employer, they shall be entitled to pay only for the hours actually worked in the day and minimum conditions shall not apply.
texts.text: If  an  employee  stops  work  for  reasons  of  their  own,  and  without  the  approval  of  the Employer, they shall be entitled to pay only for the hours actually worked in the day and minimum conditions shall not apply.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Subject to all of the above, it shall be the Employer's prerogative to decide whenever work shall be stopped during the day for any reason.
texts.text: Subject to all of the above, it shall be the Employer's prerogative to decide whenever work shall be stopped during the day for any reason.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This Letter of Understanding shall be attached to and form part of and the maintenance agreement between the parties and its duration will mirror that of the agreement.

texts.text: An individual must be referred to a substance abuse expert following a failure to comply with the Canadian  Model  for  Providing  a  Safe  Workplace:  Alcohol  and  Drug  Guidelines  and Work Rule (the "Canadian Model").

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Local Lodge acknowledges that the contractor to whom the individual would have been dispatched will refer the individual for assessment following contravention of Article 3.0 of the  Canadian  Model  for  any  site  access  testing  that  may  be  required  in  accordance  with Article  4.7  of  the  Canadian  Model  but  agrees  and  understands  that  such  referral  does  not make  the  individual  an  employee  of  the  contractor  for  the  purposes  of  the  collective agreement between the Association and the Local Lodge.
texts.text: The Local Lodge acknowledges that the contractor to whom the individual would have been dispatched will refer the individual for assessment following contravention of Article 3.0 of the  Canadian  Model  for  any  site  access  testing  that  may  be  required  in  accordance  with Article  4.7  of  the  Canadian  Model  but  agrees  and  understands  that  such  referral  does  not make  the  individual  an  employee  of  the  contractor  for  the  purposes  of  the  collective agreement between the Association and the Local Lodge.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Once the individual is assessed by a substance abuse expert, recommendations are prepared and disclosed for the purpose of establishing expectations in accordance with the substance abuse expert's recommendations, entering into a post assessment agreement and supporting compliance with prescribed aftercare.
texts.text: Once the individual is assessed by a substance abuse expert, recommendations are prepared and disclosed for the purpose of establishing expectations in accordance with the substance abuse expert's recommendations, entering into a post assessment agreement and supporting compliance with prescribed aftercare.

texts.label: text

texts.text: A member who has violated the Canadian Model or tested non-negative on a site access A&D test must  be  assessed by a substance abuse  expert and  comply  with  the  resulting recommendations as a condition of being eligible for future dispatches.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: There are advantages to referring substance abuse expert recommendations to qualified third party professionals for administration on behalf of the parties. Third party professionals are positioned to offer a higher level of:

texts.orig: 1) Substance abuse expert recommendations arising from Employer administered A&D tests  conducted pursuant to the Canadian Model and arising from those who violate Article 3 of the Canadian Model shall be referred to and administered by Homewood Health Inc. (third party professionals). Such substance abuse expert recommendations shall  apply  to  employment  and  prospective  employment in  respect  to  any  collective agreement  to  which  the  Local  Lodge  and  the  Association  are  signatory.  Substance abuse expert recommendations shall be shared with an Employer only if they are in respect to a current employee, who has contravened Article 3 of the Canadian Model, while in the employ of that Employer.
texts.text: Substance abuse expert recommendations arising from Employer administered A&D tests  conducted pursuant to the Canadian Model and arising from those who violate Article 3 of the Canadian Model shall be referred to and administered by Homewood Health Inc. (third party professionals). Such substance abuse expert recommendations shall  apply  to  employment  and  prospective  employment in  respect  to  any  collective agreement  to  which  the  Local  Lodge  and  the  Association  are  signatory.  Substance abuse expert recommendations shall be shared with an Employer only if they are in respect to a current employee, who has contravened Article 3 of the Canadian Model, while in the employ of that Employer.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2) Service providers including Homewood Health Inc. will keep all information in accordance with applicable privacy laws.
texts.text: Service providers including Homewood Health Inc. will keep all information in accordance with applicable privacy laws.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3) The Association will provide the funding to the third party providers who are responsible for administering substance abuse expert recommendations.
texts.text: The Association will provide the funding to the third party providers who are responsible for administering substance abuse expert recommendations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4) The Local Lodge will not knowingly dispatch an individual who has violated Article 3  of  the  Canadian  Model  or  tested  non-negative  on  a  site  access  test  until  the individual has been assessed and has agreed to follow any treatment recommendations made by the third party provider.
texts.text: The Local Lodge will not knowingly dispatch an individual who has violated Article 3  of  the  Canadian  Model  or  tested  non-negative  on  a  site  access  test  until  the individual has been assessed and has agreed to follow any treatment recommendations made by the third party provider.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5) When  an  individual  is  referred  for  assessment  by  a  substance  abuse  expert, Homewood Health Inc. shall promptly disclose the referral  to  the  Local  Lodge  in order  to  ensure  that  the  individual  does  not  obtain  a  new  dispatch  before  being assessed.
texts.text: When  an  individual  is  referred  for  assessment  by  a  substance  abuse  expert, Homewood Health Inc. shall promptly disclose the referral  to  the  Local  Lodge  in order  to  ensure  that  the  individual  does  not  obtain  a  new  dispatch  before  being assessed.

texts.orig: 6) This  Letter  of  Understanding  shall  be  attached  to  and  form  part  of  and  the maintenance agreement between the parties and its duration will mirror that of the agreement.

texts.orig: Re: Rapid Site Access Program
texts.text: Re: Rapid Site Access Program

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Whereas:
texts.text: Whereas:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A. The  parties  intend  to  reduce  redundant  substance  testing  and  related  costs  and  to expedite access to participating worksites.
texts.text: The  parties  intend  to  reduce  redundant  substance  testing  and  related  costs  and  to expedite access to participating worksites.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B. Alcohol and other drug work rules, such as the Canadian Model for Providing a Safe Workplace: Alcohol and Drug Guidelines and Work Rule (the ' Canadian Model '), are more effective if they are implemented in such a way as to preserve the  dignity and privacy of participant employees.
texts.text: Alcohol and other drug work rules, such as the Canadian Model for Providing a Safe Workplace: Alcohol and Drug Guidelines and Work Rule (the ' Canadian Model '), are more effective if they are implemented in such a way as to preserve the  dignity and privacy of participant employees.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C. Coordinating the exchange of sensitive information through a centralized third party provides greater control over the collection, use, disclosure, safeguards, and storage of personal information.
texts.text: Coordinating the exchange of sensitive information through a centralized third party provides greater control over the collection, use, disclosure, safeguards, and storage of personal information.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: D. Retaining the continuity of information through a centralized third party is necessary in order to reduce redundant testing, expedite access to worksites and provide seamless after-care support to affected employees.
texts.text: Retaining the continuity of information through a centralized third party is necessary in order to reduce redundant testing, expedite access to worksites and provide seamless after-care support to affected employees.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: E. Comprehensive professional third party case administration provides for the effective delivery  of  education,  compliance  and,  if  necessary,  accommodation  strategies. Professional treatment, education, follow-up and after-care frameworks  support affected  employees  in  maintaining  compliance  with  the Canadian  Model and,  if necessary, recovering from an addiction and/or dependency to alcohol or other drugs.
texts.text: Comprehensive professional third party case administration provides for the effective delivery  of  education,  compliance  and,  if  necessary,  accommodation  strategies. Professional treatment, education, follow-up and after-care frameworks  support affected  employees  in  maintaining  compliance  with  the Canadian  Model and,  if necessary, recovering from an addiction and/or dependency to alcohol or other drugs.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: F. In 2004, the Department of Health and Human Services Substance Abuse and Mental Health  Services  Administration  and,  in  2008,  leading  experts  in  direct  consultation, confirmed  that  laboratory  oral  fluid  testing  is  accurate,  reliable,  and  appropriate  for unannounced testing. Due to the shorter detection windows than found in urine testing, it  was  found  that  oral  fluid  testing  is  not  appropriate  for  follow-up  testing  and  not appropriate for testing where prior notice of the test is given.
texts.text: In 2004, the Department of Health and Human Services Substance Abuse and Mental Health  Services  Administration  and,  in  2008,  leading  experts  in  direct  consultation, confirmed  that  laboratory  oral  fluid  testing  is  accurate,  reliable,  and  appropriate  for unannounced testing. Due to the shorter detection windows than found in urine testing, it  was  found  that  oral  fluid  testing  is  not  appropriate  for  follow-up  testing  and  not appropriate for testing where prior notice of the test is given.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: G. Several Arbitration cases have accepted the validity of laboratory oral fluid testing but in none of those cases was the laboratory oral fluid testing itself  the
texts.text: Several Arbitration cases have accepted the validity of laboratory oral fluid testing but in none of those cases was the laboratory oral fluid testing itself  the

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Subject to (2) and (3) below, the parties support the implementation of the Rapid Site Access  Program  and  the  Local  Lodge  and  the  Employer  agree  to  be  bound  by  and comply with the Rapid Site Access Program Procedural Rules, as amended from time to time.
texts.text: Subject to (2) and (3) below, the parties support the implementation of the Rapid Site Access  Program  and  the  Local  Lodge  and  the  Employer  agree  to  be  bound  by  and comply with the Rapid Site Access Program Procedural Rules, as amended from time to time.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The Local  Lodge's agreement  in  (1)  above  is  subject  to  the  adoption  of  laboratory based oral fluid testing for the random component of drug testing administered by the Rapid  Site  Access  Program.  However,  in  the  event  laboratory  oral  fluid  testing  is successfully challenged in law, the Local Lodge agrees urine based testing shall apply.
texts.text: The Local  Lodge's agreement  in  (1)  above  is  subject  to  the  adoption  of  laboratory based oral fluid testing for the random component of drug testing administered by the Rapid  Site  Access  Program.  However,  in  the  event  laboratory  oral  fluid  testing  is successfully challenged in law, the Local Lodge agrees urine based testing shall apply.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. Subject to (2) above, where the Local Lodge does not agree to an amendment to the Rapid  Site  Access  Program  Procedural  Rules, the  Local  Lodge  may  opt-out  of agreeing to said amendment by giving notice in writing to the Registered Employers' Organization and the Rapid Site Administrative Committee.
texts.text: Subject to (2) above, where the Local Lodge does not agree to an amendment to the Rapid  Site  Access  Program  Procedural  Rules, the  Local  Lodge  may  opt-out  of agreeing to said amendment by giving notice in writing to the Registered Employers' Organization and the Rapid Site Administrative Committee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. For Industrial work, the Employer  contributions shall be established by the' Association  and  may  be  changed  by  the  Board  of  Directors  of  the  Association,  and notice  to  an  Employer  and  the  Local  Lodge  from  the  Association  respecting  such amendment  shall  be  sufficient.  Rapid  Site  Access  Program  contributions  shall  be forwarded  to  the  Association,  at  an  address  provided  by  the  Association.  These contributions shall be used by the Boilermaker Contractors' Association to provide the funding,  among  other  things,  for  the  third  party  providers  who  are  responsible  for delivering the services in respect to the Rapid Site Access Program.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Whereas individuals who have had a violation of the Canadian Model for Providing a Safe Workplace Alcohol and Drug Guidelines and Work Rule (the 'Canadian Model') may be required to attend post assessment counselling (PAC) and submit to follow up testing over a prescribed period of time as part of their substance abuse expert (SAE) recommendations and return to work agreement; and
texts.text: Whereas individuals who have had a violation of the Canadian Model for Providing a Safe Workplace Alcohol and Drug Guidelines and Work Rule (the 'Canadian Model') may be required to attend post assessment counselling (PAC) and submit to follow up testing over a prescribed period of time as part of their substance abuse expert (SAE) recommendations and return to work agreement; and

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Whereas PAC and follow up testing are put on hiatus when an individual not employed with an RSAP Participating Contractor or not employed thereby extending the time that an individual remains in case managed aftercare beyond the prescribed period of time in  the SAE recommendations; and
texts.text: Whereas PAC and follow up testing are put on hiatus when an individual not employed with an RSAP Participating Contractor or not employed thereby extending the time that an individual remains in case managed aftercare beyond the prescribed period of time in  the SAE recommendations; and

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Whereas successful completion of the SAE recommendations during the prescribed period of time provides for the best opportunity of success for the individual to return to work and sustain continued employment in a safety sensitive environment;
texts.text: Whereas successful completion of the SAE recommendations during the prescribed period of time provides for the best opportunity of success for the individual to return to work and sustain continued employment in a safety sensitive environment;

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Now therefore, it is Agreed between the parties hereto that:
texts.text: Now therefore, it is Agreed between the parties hereto that:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1) Individuals who are in case managed aftercare for a violation of the Canadian Model and who are not working for a Participating RSAP Contractor or employed under the collective agreement between the  parties  listed  above  and  are  not  eligible  for  funding  under  the Boilermaker  Contractors  of  Alberta  Employee  Assistance  Program  ('BCABEAP') eligibility  criteria,  shall  be  permitted  Local  Lodge  option  to  participate  in  continuing their  case  managed  aftercare.  The  Local  Lodge  and  the  individual  must  state  their agreement to participate in continuing case managed aftercare in writing. This written agreement will allow the required case managed aftercare to continue and be conducted during the prescribed period of time as stated in the SAE recommendations.
texts.text: Individuals who are in case managed aftercare for a violation of the Canadian Model and who are not working for a Participating RSAP Contractor or employed under the collective agreement between the  parties  listed  above  and  are  not  eligible  for  funding  under  the Boilermaker  Contractors  of  Alberta  Employee  Assistance  Program  ('BCABEAP') eligibility  criteria,  shall  be  permitted  Local  Lodge  option  to  participate  in  continuing their  case  managed  aftercare.  The  Local  Lodge  and  the  individual  must  state  their agreement to participate in continuing case managed aftercare in writing. This written agreement will allow the required case managed aftercare to continue and be conducted during the prescribed period of time as stated in the SAE recommendations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2) When the individual is not working for an RSAP Participating Contractor or employed under  the  collective  agreement  between  the  parties  listed  above;  is  not  eligible  for funding with BCABEAP; and has selected this option in writing, the individual will be responsible for all associated costs of case managed  aftercare as per the case management  eligibility  criteria  established.  The  associated  costs  may  include  the substance abuse assessment, post assessment counselling, return to work testing, followup testing and case management services provided by the third party case administrator and administrative costs.
texts.text: When the individual is not working for an RSAP Participating Contractor or employed under  the  collective  agreement  between  the  parties  listed  above;  is  not  eligible  for funding with BCABEAP; and has selected this option in writing, the individual will be responsible for all associated costs of case managed  aftercare as per the case management  eligibility  criteria  established.  The  associated  costs  may  include  the substance abuse assessment, post assessment counselling, return to work testing, followup testing and case management services provided by the third party case administrator and administrative costs.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3) Where  the  Local  Lodge  and  the  individual  have  agreed  in  writing  to  participate  in continuing case managed aftercare including offsite testing and where the
texts.text: Where  the  Local  Lodge  and  the  individual  have  agreed  in  writing  to  participate  in continuing case managed aftercare including offsite testing and where the

The individual, when classified inactive, will be ineligible for dispatch until his/her status is classified as active by  the  3 rd party  case  administrator.  The  individual  will  be  required  to  self-fund  all associated  costs  (as  listed  in  2)  above)  and  comply  with  the  recommendations  as reported in the SAE Report to be classified as  active.

texts.text: The Canadian Model For Providing A Safe Workplace, Version 6.1 in its original format shall be incorporated into and form part of the collective agreement; except that Articles 2.2(d) and 4.2.2(c) are interpreted as follows:

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Article 2.2 (d) shall be interpreted so that the term 'Industry Stakeholder' shall include and incorporate the bargaining agent or labour provider to which employees belongs.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Local Lodge commits to creating an online portal to house the Alberta Job Ready Dispatch (AJRD)  training records listed under Article 6.06 to provide Employers with the ability to access and download the records to make it easier for Employers to complete the necessary health and safety due diligence before permitting the employee to start work, and to comply with the requirements set out in the Occupational Health and Safety Act and its regulations.
texts.text: The Local Lodge commits to creating an online portal to house the Alberta Job Ready Dispatch (AJRD)  training records listed under Article 6.06 to provide Employers with the ability to access and download the records to make it easier for Employers to complete the necessary health and safety due diligence before permitting the employee to start work, and to comply with the requirements set out in the Occupational Health and Safety Act and its regulations.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Local Lodge further commits to have the above-mentioned online portal for Employers to access employee (ADJR) training records developed and implemented by December 31, 2025.

texts.orig: 1) COMPRESSED WORK WEEK ARRANGEMENTS
texts.text: 1) COMPRESSED WORK WEEK ARRANGEMENTS

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) The parties to this Agreement agree that the maximum of nine (9) hours shall constitute a normal days work beginning at 7:30 a.m. and ending at 5:00 p.m. (excluding a one-half hour (1/2) lunch break) may be utilized if restricted to Long Term Base Crew employees. With the understanding that this work schedule is utilized to compensate the employees for hours lost during the twenty-six (26) yearly earned days off (EDO's), in keeping with the terms of the Maintenance Contract with Suncor, Edmonton Refinery, the maximum normal work week shall be forty-five (45) hours beginning Monday at 7:30 a.m. and ending Friday at 5:00 p.m. Of the twentysix (26) EDO's, eighteen (18) will be scheduled by Suncor and the remaining eight (8) will be designated as flex EDO's to be taken as mutually agreed between the employee and the supervisor.
texts.text: The parties to this Agreement agree that the maximum of nine (9) hours shall constitute a normal days work beginning at 7:30 a.m. and ending at 5:00 p.m. (excluding a one-half hour (1/2) lunch break) may be utilized if restricted to Long Term Base Crew employees. With the understanding that this work schedule is utilized to compensate the employees for hours lost during the twenty-six (26) yearly earned days off (EDO's), in keeping with the terms of the Maintenance Contract with Suncor, Edmonton Refinery, the maximum normal work week shall be forty-five (45) hours beginning Monday at 7:30 a.m. and ending Friday at 5:00 p.m. Of the twentysix (26) EDO's, eighteen (18) will be scheduled by Suncor and the remaining eight (8) will be designated as flex EDO's to be taken as mutually agreed between the employee and the supervisor.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: It is understood that when an employee is hired with the intentions of an employment term of more than a six (6) week period, that employee will be automatically on the aforementioned Compressed Work Week arrangements and be considered as a Long Term Base Crew employee.
texts.text: It is understood that when an employee is hired with the intentions of an employment term of more than a six (6) week period, that employee will be automatically on the aforementioned Compressed Work Week arrangements and be considered as a Long Term Base Crew employee.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Should an employee be terminated prior to working six (6) weeks, an adjustment shall be made in accordance with the terms of Clause b).
texts.text: Should an employee be terminated prior to working six (6) weeks, an adjustment shall be made in accordance with the terms of Clause b).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) It is understood that when employees are hired with the intentions of short-term employment (defined as less than six (6) weeks from the date of hire) that they will be paid time and one-half (1 1/2) for the ninth (9th) hour.
texts.text: It is understood that when employees are hired with the intentions of short-term employment (defined as less than six (6) weeks from the date of hire) that they will be paid time and one-half (1 1/2) for the ninth (9th) hour.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Should the employee be employed onsite after six (6) weeks on the job, that employee will then be considered part of the Long Term Crew and paid in in item (e) below).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) Overtime payments for work on the scheduled eighteen (18) days off will be at time and one half (1 ½) for the first twelve (12) hours and double-time (2) paid
texts.text: Overtime payments for work on the scheduled eighteen (18) days off will be at time and one half (1 ½) for the first twelve (12) hours and double-time (2) paid

texts.label: text
texts.orig: thereafter. Double-time (2) will be paid for all hours worked on Sundays and Statutory Holidays. If an employee is asked to work their scheduled flex day off without being given forty- eight (48) hours notice, then the employee will be paid overtime at time and one half (1 ½) for up to twelve (12) hours except on Sundays and Statutory Holidays where double-time (2) will be paid for all hours worked. Once scheduled, requests for employees to work on flex days will only be made a last resort, after all reasonable options are made to find alternate arrangements.
texts.text: thereafter. Double-time (2) will be paid for all hours worked on Sundays and Statutory Holidays. If an employee is asked to work their scheduled flex day off without being given forty- eight (48) hours notice, then the employee will be paid overtime at time and one half (1 ½) for up to twelve (12) hours except on Sundays and Statutory Holidays where double-time (2) will be paid for all hours worked. Once scheduled, requests for employees to work on flex days will only be made a last resort, after all reasonable options are made to find alternate arrangements.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If a long term employee is terminated without having a flex EDO within the previous six (6) weeks, then an adjustment will be made to pay any regular hours worked in excess of two hundred and forty (240) hours over the previous six (6) weeks at the applicable overtime rate.
texts.text: If a long term employee is terminated without having a flex EDO within the previous six (6) weeks, then an adjustment will be made to pay any regular hours worked in excess of two hundred and forty (240) hours over the previous six (6) weeks at the applicable overtime rate.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d) The employee will provide a minimum of seven (7) days notice when requesting flex. EDO's. Special circumstances will be considered by the supervisor wherein a shorter notice period may be allowed. It is understood that: the onus is on the employee to request the flex EDO's; that these EDO's are over and above the minimum vacation and statutory holiday required by law, and that overtime payment will not be made for flex days not taken by the employee with the exception of those circumstances outlined in items b) and c) above

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e) During a period of Plant Shutdown, all employees hired with the intentions of short- term employment shall be paid based on five (5) eight (8) hour days Monday to Friday or four (4) ten (10) hour days Monday to Thursday and or Tuesday to Friday. Those hired for the Plant Shutdown will continue to receive compensation under the terms of short term employment until the conclusion of the work even if they are on site longer than six (6) weeks. All Long Term Base Crew employees shall remain on the compensation terms of the Compressed Work Week arrangements where applicable overtime payments will be made for work on a scheduled day off as per Clause  c).
texts.text: During a period of Plant Shutdown, all employees hired with the intentions of short- term employment shall be paid based on five (5) eight (8) hour days Monday to Friday or four (4) ten (10) hour days Monday to Thursday and or Tuesday to Friday. Those hired for the Plant Shutdown will continue to receive compensation under the terms of short term employment until the conclusion of the work even if they are on site longer than six (6) weeks. All Long Term Base Crew employees shall remain on the compensation terms of the Compressed Work Week arrangements where applicable overtime payments will be made for work on a scheduled day off as per Clause  c).

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Definitions:
texts.text: Definitions:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Long Term Maintenance : Is work performed as on-going routine maintenance.
texts.text: Long Term Maintenance : Is work performed as on-going routine maintenance.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Short  Term  Maintenance: Work  performed  by  employees  working  either  a  planned  or unplanned events not considered new construction that is of a temporary nature.
texts.text: Short  Term  Maintenance: Work  performed  by  employees  working  either  a  planned  or unplanned events not considered new construction that is of a temporary nature.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Contractors (by mutual agreement between the Local Lodge and the BCA) currently operating under  long  term  maintenance  contracts  will  be  deemed  to  have  met  duration  and  contractual thresholds, and as such, will be grandfathered into this agreement upon receipt of notice.
texts.text: Contractors (by mutual agreement between the Local Lodge and the BCA) currently operating under  long  term  maintenance  contracts  will  be  deemed  to  have  met  duration  and  contractual thresholds, and as such, will be grandfathered into this agreement upon receipt of notice.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Moving forward, any Employer desiring to utilize this Letter of Understanding (LOU) for long term maintenance, must apply to the Boilermaker Contractors' Association and the International Brotherhood  of  Boilermakers,  Local  Lodge  146  for  purposes  of  review  and  orientation  and present written evidence of the Owner's intent to engage that Employer in the performance of maintenance services  for  a  minimum  period  of  one  full  year,  subject  to  the  usual  termination clauses in such contracts.
texts.text: Moving forward, any Employer desiring to utilize this Letter of Understanding (LOU) for long term maintenance, must apply to the Boilermaker Contractors' Association and the International Brotherhood  of  Boilermakers,  Local  Lodge  146  for  purposes  of  review  and  orientation  and present written evidence of the Owner's intent to engage that Employer in the performance of maintenance services  for  a  minimum  period  of  one  full  year,  subject  to  the  usual  termination clauses in such contracts.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: It  is  further  understood  that  the  LOU  for  long  term  maintenance  shall  not  be  applicable  for 'shutdown' or 'turnaround' work except when such work is performed within the scope of full or year-round supplementary maintenance contracts.  In order to implement this restriction, it is understood that on newly constructed plants or units a shutdown may occur at any time under the terms  of  the  LOU  for  long  term  maintenance  but  existing  plants  employing  this  service  must have been under contract for full or year-round supplementary Maintenance service for at least four  months  prior  to  commencement  of  the  shutdown/turnaround  or  such  work  shall  be performed under the terms of the local Construction Agreement.
texts.text: It  is  further  understood  that  the  LOU  for  long  term  maintenance  shall  not  be  applicable  for 'shutdown' or 'turnaround' work except when such work is performed within the scope of full or year-round supplementary maintenance contracts.  In order to implement this restriction, it is understood that on newly constructed plants or units a shutdown may occur at any time under the terms  of  the  LOU  for  long  term  maintenance  but  existing  plants  employing  this  service  must have been under contract for full or year-round supplementary Maintenance service for at least four  months  prior  to  commencement  of  the  shutdown/turnaround  or  such  work  shall  be performed under the terms of the local Construction Agreement.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Should the contract for full or year-round supplementary maintenance be terminated during the term of this LOU for long term maintenance for any of the projects listed, this LOU for long term maintenance shall be considered null and void as it applies to that project or projects.
texts.text: Should the contract for full or year-round supplementary maintenance be terminated during the term of this LOU for long term maintenance for any of the projects listed, this LOU for long term maintenance shall be considered null and void as it applies to that project or projects.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article 1.000 Compressed Work Week Conditions
texts.text: Article 1.000 Compressed Work Week Conditions

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article 1.100
texts.text: Article 1.100

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A "Compressed Work Week" system may be established when it is intended to operate the system in excess of fourteen (14) calendar days. The system may be arranged to cover continuous plant operation for seven (7) days per week.
texts.text: A "Compressed Work Week" system may be established when it is intended to operate the system in excess of fourteen (14) calendar days. The system may be arranged to cover continuous plant operation for seven (7) days per week.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  fourteen  (14)  calendar  day  requirement  does  not  apply  to  those  compressed  work  week schedules that average forty (40) hours per week, Monday to Friday. In this case, the schedule must be established for a minimum of one (1) week timeframe, Monday to Friday.
texts.text: The  fourteen  (14)  calendar  day  requirement  does  not  apply  to  those  compressed  work  week schedules that average forty (40) hours per week, Monday to Friday. In this case, the schedule must be established for a minimum of one (1) week timeframe, Monday to Friday.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article 1.101
texts.text: Article 1.101

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Employees engaged under the Compressed Work Week shift conditions must complete fourteen (14) days or four (4) days as noted above except that when an employee is replaced within the shift for any reason (temporarily or permanently) both the replaced employee and the replacing employee shall be considered as the same for determining pay conditions under this Article.
texts.text: Employees engaged under the Compressed Work Week shift conditions must complete fourteen (14) days or four (4) days as noted above except that when an employee is replaced within the shift for any reason (temporarily or permanently) both the replaced employee and the replacing employee shall be considered as the same for determining pay conditions under this Article.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article 1.102
texts.text: Article 1.102

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In the event that the fourteen (14) day conditions are not met, pay conditions will be adjusted to pay  eight  (8)  hours  per  day  Monday  through  Friday  at  the  straight  time  hourly  rate,  plus applicable  shift  premium,  and  all  hours  worked  after  the  eight  (8)  hours  per  day,  Monday through Friday and all hours worked on Saturday and Sunday at the applicable overtime rates.
texts.text: In the event that the fourteen (14) day conditions are not met, pay conditions will be adjusted to pay  eight  (8)  hours  per  day  Monday  through  Friday  at  the  straight  time  hourly  rate,  plus applicable  shift  premium,  and  all  hours  worked  after  the  eight  (8)  hours  per  day,  Monday through Friday and all hours worked on Saturday and Sunday at the applicable overtime rates.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article 1.102.1
texts.text: Article 1.102.1

texts.label: text
texts.orig: When  an  employee  is  transferred  from  one  Compressed  Work  Week  schedule  to  another Compressed  Work  Week  schedule  and  either  schedule  does  not  last  fourteen  (14)  days,  pay conditions will be adjusted in accordance with Article 1.102 for that cycle.
texts.text: When  an  employee  is  transferred  from  one  Compressed  Work  Week  schedule  to  another Compressed  Work  Week  schedule  and  either  schedule  does  not  last  fourteen  (14)  days,  pay conditions will be adjusted in accordance with Article 1.102 for that cycle.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article 1.103
texts.text: Article 1.103

texts.label: text
texts.orig: It is understood that Compressed Work Week Schedules A through Y have been established and such schedules may be reactivated without approval of the Local Lodge (see attached Appendix "A").
texts.text: It is understood that Compressed Work Week Schedules A through Y have been established and such schedules may be reactivated without approval of the Local Lodge (see attached Appendix "A").

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article 1.104
texts.text: Article 1.104

texts.label: text
texts.orig: When a compressed work week schedule has not been established as noted in Article 1.103, such schedules must be mutually agreed to between the Local Lodge and the Employer.
texts.text: When a compressed work week schedule has not been established as noted in Article 1.103, such schedules must be mutually agreed to between the Local Lodge and the Employer.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Employer may request that any new shift, once established, be added to the schedules referred to in Article 1.103.
texts.text: The Employer may request that any new shift, once established, be added to the schedules referred to in Article 1.103.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article 1.200
texts.text: Article 1.200

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The standard work day shall be up to twelve (12) hours of continuous employment including lunch breaks except those breaks provided for in Article 1.506.
texts.text: The standard work day shall be up to twelve (12) hours of continuous employment including lunch breaks except those breaks provided for in Article 1.506.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article 1.300
texts.text: Article 1.300

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) All overtime worked in excess of a regularly scheduled twelve (12), ten (10) or eight (8) hour shift  and  all  hours  worked  on  regularly  scheduled  days  off  shall  be  paid  at  the  applicable
texts.text: All overtime worked in excess of a regularly scheduled twelve (12), ten (10) or eight (8) hour shift  and  all  hours  worked  on  regularly  scheduled  days  off  shall  be  paid  at  the  applicable

texts.label: text

texts.text: overtime provisions in accordance with the established Compressed Work Week rates.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. On  the  twelve  (12)  hour  day,  all  Earned  Days  Off (EDO's) will  be  compensated  as follows: The first three (3) hours worked at double-time (2x)
texts.text: On  the  twelve  (12)  hour  day,  all  Earned  Days  Off (EDO's) will  be  compensated  as follows: The first three (3) hours worked at double-time (2x)

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: The next six (6) hours worked at time and one half (1½x) The last three (3) hours worked at double-time (2x).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. On the ten (10) hour day, all EDO's will be compensated as follows: The first two and one half (2 ½) hours worked at double-time (2x) The next five (5) hours worked at time and one half (1 ½x) The last two and one half (2 ½) hours worked at double-time (2x)
texts.text: On the ten (10) hour day, all EDO's will be compensated as follows: The first two and one half (2 ½) hours worked at double-time (2x) The next five (5) hours worked at time and one half (1 ½x) The last two and one half (2 ½) hours worked at double-time (2x)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. On the eight (8) hour day, all EDO's will be compensated as follows:
texts.text: On the eight (8) hour day, all EDO's will be compensated as follows:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The first two (2) hours worked at double-time (2x)
texts.text: The first two (2) hours worked at double-time (2x)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The next four (4) hours worked at time and one half (1 ½x)
texts.text: The next four (4) hours worked at time and one half (1 ½x)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The last two (2) hours at double-time (2x)
texts.text: The last two (2) hours at double-time (2x)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) All hours worked on Statutory Holidays will be paid at double-time (2x) in accordance with Compressed Work Week rates.
texts.text: All hours worked on Statutory Holidays will be paid at double-time (2x) in accordance with Compressed Work Week rates.

texts.text: All time worked on statutory holidays, as listed in Article 1.400, shall be paid at the applicable overtime rate, but in no case shall overtime rates exceed double the hourly day rate except as noted in Article 1.300 (b).

texts.orig: Article 1.403
texts.text: Article 1.403

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Compressed Work Week Shift Premiums
texts.text: Compressed Work Week Shift Premiums

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: i) Number of hours on shift per cycle x number of cycles per year = NUMBER OF HOURS ON SHIFT PER YEAR.
texts.text: Number of hours on shift per cycle x number of cycles per year = NUMBER OF HOURS ON SHIFT PER YEAR.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ii) Number of hours on shift per year x shift premium = TOTAL SHIFT PREMIUM.
texts.text: ii) Number of hours on shift per year x shift premium = TOTAL SHIFT PREMIUM.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iii) Total shift premium divided by the number of hours in a standard year = SHIFT PREMIUM PER HOUR.
texts.text: iii) Total shift premium divided by the number of hours in a standard year = SHIFT PREMIUM PER HOUR.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iv) The shift premium on all compressed work week night shifts will be three dollars and fifty cents ($3.50) per hour for all straight time hours worked on shift.
texts.text: iv) The shift premium on all compressed work week night shifts will be three dollars and fifty cents ($3.50) per hour for all straight time hours worked on shift.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article 1.504
texts.text: Article 1.504

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Compressed Work Week Overtime Rate
texts.text: Compressed Work Week Overtime Rate

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: i) Number of hours per cycle x number of cycles per year = NUMBER OF ACTUAL HOURS PER YEAR.
texts.text: Number of hours per cycle x number of cycles per year = NUMBER OF ACTUAL HOURS PER YEAR.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ii) Number of actual hours per year minus number of hours in a standard year = NUMBER OF OVERTIME HOURS PER YEAR.
texts.text: ii) Number of actual hours per year minus number of hours in a standard year = NUMBER OF OVERTIME HOURS PER YEAR.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iii) Number of overtime hours per year x overtime premium (2X) x Long-Term rate = TOTAL OVERTIME DOLLARS.
texts.text: iii) Number of overtime hours per year x overtime premium (2X) x Long-Term rate = TOTAL OVERTIME DOLLARS.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iv) Standard hours per year x Long-Term rate plus total overtime dollars (divided by the actual hours of work per year) = COMPRESSED WORK WEEK OVERTIME RATE.
texts.text: iv) Standard hours per year x Long-Term rate plus total overtime dollars (divided by the actual hours of work per year) = COMPRESSED WORK WEEK OVERTIME RATE.

texts.label: section_header

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: i) A year is defined as three hundred and sixty-four (364) days (fifty-two (52) x seven (7)).
texts.text: A year is defined as three hundred and sixty-four (364) days (fifty-two (52) x seven (7)).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ii) A standard year is two thousand and eighty (2,080) hours (fifty-two (52) x forty (40)).
texts.text: ii) A standard year is two thousand and eighty (2,080) hours (fifty-two (52) x forty (40)).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iii) Total hours per cycle is defined as the sum of the hours worked on all days in cycle.
texts.text: iii) Total hours per cycle is defined as the sum of the hours worked on all days in cycle.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iv) Number  of  cycles  =  NUMBER  OF  DAYS  IN  A  CYCLE  DIVIDED  INTO  THREE HUNDRED AND SIXTY-FOUR (364).
texts.text: iv) Number  of  cycles  =  NUMBER  OF  DAYS  IN  A  CYCLE  DIVIDED  INTO  THREE HUNDRED AND SIXTY-FOUR (364).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: v) Number  of  hours  on  shift  per  cycle  =  SUM  OF  THE  HOURS  WORKED  ON  ALL AFTERNOON OR NIGHT SHIFTS DURING A CYCLE.
texts.text: Number  of  hours  on  shift  per  cycle  =  SUM  OF  THE  HOURS  WORKED  ON  ALL AFTERNOON OR NIGHT SHIFTS DURING A CYCLE.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: vi) A cycle is defined as the number of days, including scheduled days off, before the schedule repeats itself.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: On twelve (12) hour shifts when working in conjunction with the Client's personnel the breaks provided will be the same as those scheduled for the Client working the same compressed work week schedule in the area. Under no circumstances will the employee be denied their required breaks.  In all other instances there shall be three (3) half hour (1/2) paid breaks per twelve (12) hour shifts.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Shift changes from Day Work Conditions to Compressed Work Week:
texts.text: Shift changes from Day Work Conditions to Compressed Work Week:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article 1.509.1
texts.text: Article 1.509.1

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: i) If an employee has started work during a normal work week Monday through Sunday, is then changed to a Compressed Work Week schedule and not given the required earned days off, they  shall  be  paid  straight  time  for  the  first  forty  (40)  hours  worked  in  the  week  at  the applicable rate and overtime thereafter until the completion of the normal work week.
texts.text: If an employee has started work during a normal work week Monday through Sunday, is then changed to a Compressed Work Week schedule and not given the required earned days off, they  shall  be  paid  straight  time  for  the  first  forty  (40)  hours  worked  in  the  week  at  the applicable rate and overtime thereafter until the completion of the normal work week.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ii) If  an  employee has started work during a normal work week Monday through Sunday, is then changed to a Compressed Work Week schedule and given the required earned days off, they  shall  be  paid  straight  time  for  all  scheduled  hours  worked  on  the  new  Compressed Work Week shift.
texts.text: ii) If  an  employee has started work during a normal work week Monday through Sunday, is then changed to a Compressed Work Week schedule and given the required earned days off, they  shall  be  paid  straight  time  for  all  scheduled  hours  worked  on  the  new  Compressed Work Week shift.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article 1.509.2
texts.text: Article 1.509.2

texts.label: text
texts.orig: An employee will be given twenty-four (24) hours advance notice prior to the start of their new shift and if not then they shall be paid their first shift at time and one-half (1 ½x).
texts.text: An employee will be given twenty-four (24) hours advance notice prior to the start of their new shift and if not then they shall be paid their first shift at time and one-half (1 ½x).

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article 1.509.3
texts.text: Article 1.509.3

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If an employee is given greater than the normal two (2) earned days off on their regular schedule due  to  having  their  shift  changed  to  a  Compressed  Work  Week  schedule,  they  shall  be  paid straight time for those hours in excess of the earned days off they would have otherwise worked if the shift had not been changed.
texts.text: If an employee is given greater than the normal two (2) earned days off on their regular schedule due  to  having  their  shift  changed  to  a  Compressed  Work  Week  schedule,  they  shall  be  paid straight time for those hours in excess of the earned days off they would have otherwise worked if the shift had not been changed.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If an employee loses time on their initial Compressed Work Week schedule due to having their Compressed Work Week schedule changed to a new Compressed Work Week schedule, they shall be paid for those hours they would have worked on their initial schedule up to the start of their new schedule.
texts.text: If an employee loses time on their initial Compressed Work Week schedule due to having their Compressed Work Week schedule changed to a new Compressed Work Week schedule, they shall be paid for those hours they would have worked on their initial schedule up to the start of their new schedule.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In no case will missed hours be paid if the employee works forty (40) or more straight time hours in the calendar week. If less than forty (40) hours is worked in the calendar week, missed hours on the initial  schedule  will be  paid  but  only to  the  extent  that  straight  time  hours  on  the  new schedule in the calendar week plus hours worked on the old schedule in the calendar week plus missed hours on the initial schedule does not exceed forty (40).
texts.text: In no case will missed hours be paid if the employee works forty (40) or more straight time hours in the calendar week. If less than forty (40) hours is worked in the calendar week, missed hours on the initial  schedule  will be  paid  but  only to  the  extent  that  straight  time  hours  on  the  new schedule in the calendar week plus hours worked on the old schedule in the calendar week plus missed hours on the initial schedule does not exceed forty (40).

texts.text: Article 1.510.3

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The penalty of Article 1.510.2 will not apply if the employee completes their regular work days on their  initial  schedule  up  to  the  scheduled  days  off,  receives  their  scheduled  days  off  or  paid applicable overtime, if they work on their scheduled days off, and is given at least ten (10) hours notice of shift change.
texts.text: The penalty of Article 1.510.2 will not apply if the employee completes their regular work days on their  initial  schedule  up  to  the  scheduled  days  off,  receives  their  scheduled  days  off  or  paid applicable overtime, if they work on their scheduled days off, and is given at least ten (10) hours notice of shift change.

texts.text: Article 1.510.4

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Earned days off on a Compressed Work Week are days which are scheduled as regular days off and are earned when regular scheduled consecutive work days immediately preceding have been worked.
texts.text: Earned days off on a Compressed Work Week are days which are scheduled as regular days off and are earned when regular scheduled consecutive work days immediately preceding have been worked.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If a fraction of the regular work days are worked the same fraction of the immediately following regular days off are earned. Any fraction of a day shall be considered one day when calculating earned days off.
texts.text: If a fraction of the regular work days are worked the same fraction of the immediately following regular days off are earned. Any fraction of a day shall be considered one day when calculating earned days off.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: When an employee is transferred to a different shift schedule all scheduled days off which have been earned must be given to the employee prior to the start of their new schedule. If earned days off are worked they shall be considered overtime and paid the applicable overtime rate.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: For those employees with more than three (3) years of service with an Employer, the employee will be entitled to bereavement pay benefits of eight (8) hours multiplied by the employees' base wage rate for up to three (3) days of lost work incurred as a result of the employee's attendance at a funeral or memorial service upon the death of an employee's Spouse, Child, Parent, Parent -inLaw, Grandparent or Sibling. Bereavement Pay Benefits shall be paid at the straight time rate.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: CF INDUSTRIES - SCHEDULED DAY OFF SCHEDULE
texts.text: CF INDUSTRIES - SCHEDULED DAY OFF SCHEDULE

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Appendix -Scheduled Day Off Schedule (SDO), CF Industries (Medicine Hat)
texts.text: Appendix -Scheduled Day Off Schedule (SDO), CF Industries (Medicine Hat)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: To  harmonize  with  the  Owner's  in  plant  personnel  at  CF  Industries,  the  Employer  has  been approved to work an 8-9-9-8-8 work week on a Monday to Friday rotation at the facility. It is intended for on-going work (core maintenance work) and does not operate in unplanned outages, scheduled outages or during 'major shutdown' situations.
texts.text: To  harmonize  with  the  Owner's  in  plant  personnel  at  CF  Industries,  the  Employer  has  been approved to work an 8-9-9-8-8 work week on a Monday to Friday rotation at the facility. It is intended for on-going work (core maintenance work) and does not operate in unplanned outages, scheduled outages or during 'major shutdown' situations.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Guidelines of the 8-9-9-8-8 Schedule are as follows:
texts.text: Guidelines of the 8-9-9-8-8 Schedule are as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1) The schedule for regular core maintenance activities will operate on an 8-9-9-8-8 rotation on a Monday to Friday basis.
texts.text: The schedule for regular core maintenance activities will operate on an 8-9-9-8-8 rotation on a Monday to Friday basis.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2) Employees will be paid in full for all hours worked each week. (For example, if someone completes the regular  8-9-9-8-8  schedule,  they  will  be  compensated  for  forty-two  (42) hours  at  the  regular  straight  time  hourly  rate  and  all  required  contributions  under  the collective agreement will be compensated based upon fort-two (42) hours.
texts.text: Employees will be paid in full for all hours worked each week. (For example, if someone completes the regular  8-9-9-8-8  schedule,  they  will  be  compensated  for  forty-two  (42) hours  at  the  regular  straight  time  hourly  rate  and  all  required  contributions  under  the collective agreement will be compensated based upon fort-two (42) hours.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3) The first two hours of overtime on the 8-9-9-8-8 will be compensated at time and one half (1 ½).
texts.text: The first two hours of overtime on the 8-9-9-8-8 will be compensated at time and one half (1 ½).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4) The Employer will identify the core maintenance personnel who will operate under the SDO schedule.
texts.text: The Employer will identify the core maintenance personnel who will operate under the SDO schedule.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5) When  submitting  requests  for  craft  personnel  to  the  local  union,  the  Employer  will identify if the individual being hired is to be part of the core maintenance team.
texts.text: When  submitting  requests  for  craft  personnel  to  the  local  union,  the  Employer  will identify if the individual being hired is to be part of the core maintenance team.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6) The Employer will keep a record for each employee and track the number of nine (9) hour days  worked at straight time.
texts.text: The Employer will keep a record for each employee and track the number of nine (9) hour days  worked at straight time.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7) Should an employee be asked to work a Scheduled Day Off the following will apply:
texts.text: Should an employee be asked to work a Scheduled Day Off the following will apply:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Work on a SDO will be on a voluntary basis.
texts.text: Work on a SDO will be on a voluntary basis.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) All  work  on  the  SDO  will  be  paid  in  accordance  with  the  number  of  hours  an individual employee has worked since the last SDO. For example: if an individual has worked three (3) of the scheduled nine (9) hour days and are asked to work an SDO, the first five (5) hours on the schedule will be paid at the straight time rate and all additional  hours  will  be  compensated  at  the  appropriate  overtime  rate  as  per  the collective agreement.
texts.text: All  work  on  the  SDO  will  be  paid  in  accordance  with  the  number  of  hours  an individual employee has worked since the last SDO. For example: if an individual has worked three (3) of the scheduled nine (9) hour days and are asked to work an SDO, the first five (5) hours on the schedule will be paid at the straight time rate and all additional  hours  will  be  compensated  at  the  appropriate  overtime  rate  as  per  the collective agreement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) The SDO schedule will be suspended during unscheduled and scheduled outages as well  as  during  major  shutdowns/turnarounds.  (The  e mployee's  accumulated  hours worked on the nine (9) hour days will remain frozen until their return to the regular SDO Schedule.)
